document_data.name: Musings
document_data.author: [[Helsuntiir]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Musings''''' was a [[book]] penned by [[Helsuntiir]] of [[Athkatla]] in the early 13{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''If discomfort and danger be always at hand, why then adventure? There is something in mankind that leads some always on to such foolishness, and the rest of us benefit by the riches and knowledge and dreams they bring us. Why else tolerate such dangerous idiots?''|Excerpt from ''Musings''}}
document_data.History: This aptly named book collected the author's thoughts and ruminations on various topics. Some of Helsuntiir's opinions of note included his thoughts on adventurers, and the value they brought to schools and society, despite being "dangerous idiots." The book was published in the {{YearlinkName|1225}}.{{Cite web/The Candlekeep Collection}}
